soba_userInput: Complete the Middle baroque with all missing details
soba_metaModelContext:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ecore:EPackage xmi:version="2.0" xmlns:xmi="http://www.omg.org/XMI" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:ecore="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" name="mindMap" nsURI="http://mindmap/0.1" nsPrefix="map">
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="Map">
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="name">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="description">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="root" eType="//Concept" containment="true"/>
  </eClassifiers>
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="Concept">
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="name">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="subConcepts" upperBound="-1" eType="//Concept" containment="true" eOpposite="//Concept/parent"/>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="parent" eType="//Concept" eOpposite="//Concept/subConcepts"/>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="description">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="relatedTo" upperBound="-1" eType="//Concept"/>
  </eClassifiers>
</ecore:EPackage>

subConcepts.name: Jean-Baptiste Lully
subConcepts.description: (1632–1687) French court composer, central to French operatic and dance traditions

subConcepts.name: Arcangelo Corelli
subConcepts.description: (1653–1713) Italian violinist and composer; influential in development of the concerto grosso and violin technique

subConcepts.name: Dieterich Buxtehude
subConcepts.description: (c.1637–1707) North German organist and composer; important for organ and sacred music traditions

subConcepts.name: Henry Purcell
subConcepts.description: (1659–1695) English composer known for theatre music, sacred works and songs

subConcepts.name: Composers
subConcepts.description: Representative composers of the Middle Baroque period

subConcepts.name: Concerto grosso
subConcepts.description: Instrumental form contrasting a small group (concertino) with the full ensemble (ripieno); consolidated in the Middle Baroque

subConcepts.name: Oratorio
subConcepts.description: Large-scale vocal-instrumental genre with sacred narrative performed without staging

subConcepts.name: Suite (dance suite)
subConcepts.description: Sequence of dance movements; continuation and elaboration of earlier dance-suite practice

subConcepts.name: Forms and genres
subConcepts.description: Typical genres and formal types developed or consolidated during the Middle Baroque

subConcepts.name: French style
subConcepts.description: Court-centered, dance-oriented music with emphasis on ornamentation and clear dance rhythms

subConcepts.name: Italian style
subConcepts.description: Virtuosic instrumental writing and development of forms like the concerto; strong melodic focus

subConcepts.name: German style
subConcepts.description: Blend of Italian and northern traditions with emphasis on sacred music, organ repertoire and contrapuntal practice

subConcepts.name: English style
subConcepts.description: Distinctive vocal and theatre music tradition, with prominent composers writing both sacred and stage works

subConcepts.name: National styles
subConcepts.description: Regional idioms and their characteristics during the Middle Baroque

subConcepts.name: Basso continuo
subConcepts.description: Continuo practice with a bass line and harmony realization became standard, underpinning textures across genres

subConcepts.name: Consolidation of tonality
subConcepts.description: Clearer functional harmony and major/minor key orientation became more established

subConcepts.name: Monody and expressive vocal writing
subConcepts.description: Emphasis on solo voice with accompaniment for heightened expression continued and evolved

subConcepts.name: Musical characteristics
subConcepts.description: Core musical features and technical developments of the Middle Baroque

subConcepts.name: Violin family prominence
subConcepts.description: The violin and its family became central in chamber and orchestral music, with virtuosic writing emerging

subConcepts.name: Continuo instruments
subConcepts.description: Harpsichord, organ, lute and theorbo commonly realized the continuo part supporting ensembles and soloists

subConcepts.name: Instruments & ensembles
subConcepts.description: Typical instrumentations and ensemble types of the period
